text: how can I disable a bdd test? I do not want to comment it
<@U1AU8DRQR>: add a tag (commonly issue tag) to the scenario, then add that issue to the .behaverc file
for example,  issue_680 is currently disabled by using this mechanism
e.g., <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/commit/922ed1fb032637bc20de7ae1bacffe8886760d6f>
<@U1AU8DRQR>: please don't abuse this! :wink:
<@U0UKTPMG8>: could you please document that in the contributing.md? thx
<@U0KM61BCP> yes
<amiably> Oh, it used to be Hyperledger Fabric's best kept secret :wink: </amiably>
danke - and add note that we should agree on usage guidelines
eg maybe you need all maintainers to agree or super-majority

Yes, sounds good. BTW: Whatever (procedure) is decided should probably also apply to `t.Skip()` in the unit tests... though these might be less trivial to flag.
<@U0UKTPMG8>'s file makes it clearer for Behave, as it's easy to view it all in one place... we don't have the same for the skipped unit-tests.
<@U150L8BDF|clessor> has joined the channel
